definition: to select sb for a position without announcing the decision until later/to decide behind closed doors/all cut and dried
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: A quirkier example is the ability to “lock in” an interest rate.
sentences.chinese: 一个欺诈的例子就是利率“内定”方式。

sentences.english: If possible, please decide it within 3 days.
sentences.chinese: 如果有可能，请在3天内定下来。

sentences.english: The hosts are detecting the default gateway configured on the hub.
sentences.chinese: 主人正在发现在毂上被配置的内定出入口。

sentences.english: In the muscle cells it is located in the cytoplasm around the nucleus.
sentences.chinese: 这种物质在肌细胞内定位于核周的胞质中。

sentences.english: The Long is true, that is already resolved hereafter lord in the house.
sentences.chinese: 隆真，那是内定的未来的家主。

sentences.english: The rotation and the scale are inherent in the Macrom-eter vector measurement and processing technique.
sentences.chinese: 其旋转和规模是内定与测远器向量测量和加工工艺的。

definition: covert activities (election rigging etc)/under-the-table manipulations/black operations
compiled and published by Imperial command (old)
to wait to fill a vacancy/reserve (candidate)/alternate/substitute
quota/number of places/place (in an institution, a group etc)
seat of honor/person in a high-ranking position/to be promoted to a more senior role/(genetics) epistatic
to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
see 暗箱操作[an4 xiang1 cao1 zuo4]
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
